Cool Git Commands

15 Jun 2013

I just finished the awesome git course @codeschool, here are some tricks that I didnt knew;

Have you ever forgot to add some file to your previous commit? Or Just want to re-write the commit message, --amend is just what you need!

  git commit --amend

Let’s assume you are just done with some remote branch, and you want to remove them from your origin or any other remote repository

  git push remote_name :branch

Now if you want git to forget about the deleted remote branches you will need to:

  git remote prune origin

Let’s say you dont have any git GUI program, and you want to call git log with some graph visualization

  git log --oneline --graph

Wanna know when and who wrote that awfull code at a specific file?

  git blame file --date short

Want to get the diff for multiple commits?

  git diff head~2 head

<Dglgmut>
